title: Stock markets lifted by Ukraine ceasefire hopes | Business | The Guardian
summary: stock markets buoyed by hopes of ukraine ceasefire .
ons says downturn 'less deep ' than previously thought .
ftse 100 to go through quarterly reshuffle .
jobs recovery in developed world has `` only just begun , '' says oecd .
ireland leading output growth in eurozone .
eurozone retail sales slow sharply in july .

text: time to sign off , folks .
have a great afternoon .
we 'll be back tomorrow .
on wall street , the dow jones has risen more than 60 points to 17129.82 , a 0.37 % gain .
the nasdaq is up almost 8 points , or 0.17 % , at 46050.75 .

documents.title: stock markets buoyed by hopes of ukraine ceasefire
text: wall street has opened higher and european stock markets have been buoyed by news of an apparent ceasefire agreement between russia and ukraine .

ukraine said its president petro poroshenko had agreed steps towards a ceasefire regime '' with russia 's vladimir putin , but the kremlin denied a deal had been struck , creating confusion on the eve of a nato summit .

however , putin later said his views and those of his ukrainian counterpart on finding a political solution to the conflict in eastern ukraine were very close '' and held out hope that an agreement between kiev and the pro-russian rebels could by reached by friday .

the ftse 100 index in london is up nearly 60 points at 6888.67 , a 0.9 % gain ; the dax in frankfurt is 135 points higher at 9641.98 , a 1.4 % rise ; and france 's cac has climbed nearly 50 points to 4428.11 , a 1.1 % increase .
russia 's dollar-denominated rts index jumped 5.5 % while the rouble-based micex gained 3.6 % .
the rouble gained 1.9 % against the dollar .
it 's been a busy morning .
let 's have a look at today 's main developments .
there has been mostly good news about the uk economy .

the services sector is booming , according to the latest pmi survey , and survey compiler markit reckons its findings together with those for the manufacturing and construction industries point to 0.8 % economic growth in the third quarter .
the ftse 100 index jumped to a 14-year high after the survey was released .

the office for national statistics has restated the national accounts , with the conclusion that the uk recession was less deep '' than previously thought - although it remains the worst since records began in 1948 .
meanwhile , the oecd found in its employment monitor that uk workers suffered the biggest cuts in real wages in the developed world after the financial crisis .
the paris-based think tank also says the jobs recovery in the world 's major economies has only just begun '' .

in the eurozone , pressure has increased on the european central bank to take more drastic action and embark on full-scale quantitative easing , after output growth slowed markedly across the bloc last month and retail sales fell in july .
europe 's biggest fashion retailer zalando , asos ' main rival , plans a €6bn ipo in frankfurt .
george osborne has opined on the gdp revisions .
george osborne ( @ george osborne ) gdp revisions show by tackling our problems head on we 're building a stronger economy .

risks remain - we need to keep working through plan george osborne ( @ george osborne ) double dose of good economic news : uk economy climbs global rankings & new gdp data revise growth higher # longtermeconomicplan is working

documents.title: ftse 100 to go through quarterly reshuffle
text: the ftse 100 index will be going through its quarterly reshuffle today .
direct line , the insurer floated by royal bank of scotland two years ago , is seen as the most likely candidate for a place in the ftse 100 .
its promotion from the ftse 250 could come at the expense of canmaker rexam or housebuilder barratt developments .
barratt only rejoined the blue-chip index in march .
chris williams , of the uk 's first investment advice service , wealth horizon , said : today could signal a rocky time for one or more of the companies that are demoted from the index .

ftse tracker funds need to hold a certain amount of shares in each of the companies within the index , so those booted out will see the shares drop significantly as managers scurry to realign their fund portfolios to include the latest entrants instead .
with the ftse this week posting its highest level since july , the reshuffle is likely to strengthen its long-term prospects even further .
however , some investors will still be cautious to go to heavy into the index before the ecb makes a decision this week about a possible increase in its stimulus package .

there are high expectations that the european central bank may increase its stimulus package in its meeting tomorrow , following a pledge by ecb president mario draghi to use all available tools to keep the economy on course .
but investors remain cautious as there remains some significant resistance to quantitative easing , particularly in germany .

documents.title: jobs recovery in developed world has `` only just begun , '' says oecd
text: the jobs recovery in the developed world has only just begun '' and it will take years to undo the impact on employment of the financial crash of 2008 , according to the organisation for economic cooperation and development .

the paris-based think-tank said in its annual employment outlook : the employment situation has started to improve , but there is still a long way to go to make up for the job losses that occurred as a result of the global financial crisis .

for the oecd as a whole , the jobs recovery has only just begun : the oecd employment rate is currently 1.8 percentage points below its level at the start of the global financial crisis compared with 2.2 percentage points at the depth of the crisis .
the report also shows that british workers suffered the biggest decline in wages in the developed world after the financial crisis , even though unemployment has fallen .
in the uk , nearly two-thirds of workers saw falls in real wages ( adjusted for inflation ) in 2010 - more than the average of one worker in two across 19 oecd countries .
average hourly real wage rates continued to fall through to 2013 in the uk , matched or exceeded only by several eurozone countries hit hardest by the crisis like greece , spain and ireland .

chris leslie mp , labour 's shadow chief secretary to the treasury , has responded to the office for national statistics ' changes to the national accounts : these accounting changes to the way gdp is measured - for instance to include drug dealing and prostitution - do not mean families or businesses are better off .
gdp growth has been revised up in every year since 2008 .
but it 's still the case that working people are substantially worse off under this government , that the recovery was choked off in 2010 and that it is the slowest on record .

working people want a plan to tackle the cost-of-living crisis they still face , not complacent claims from ministers that everything is fixed or that accounting changes mean we 're somehow better off .

documents.title: round-up of today 's corporate news
text: europe 's biggest online fashion site zalando , the main rival to asos , has unveiled plans for an ipo that could value it at up to €6bn .
it plans to list a 10-11 % stake in the business on the frankfurt stock exchange in the hope of raising more than €500m to fund further expansion .

this comes amid a flurry of e-commerce flotations , with chinese giant alibaba due to float later this month ( 18 september ) , along with the german venture capital house rocket internet , which helped launch zalando and many other start-ups .
here 's a profile of zalando founder robert gentz , a former economist from düsseldorf who had the initial idea on a beach in guatemala .

the founders of hargreaves lansdown have reaped more than £ 68m in annual dividends after royal mail 's flotation helped business to boom at the investment company , my colleague sean farrell reports .
peter hargreaves , who owns 32.18 % , will make £ 45.7m while stephen lansdown , who owns 15.92 % according to reuters , will receive £ 22.6m .
with booming construction markets in the us and britain inceasing demand for its industrial equipment hire business , ashtead has increased its guidance for annual profit .

documents.title: ireland leading output growth in eurozone
text: the breakdown of the markit composite index for the eurozone reveals that ireland remained at the top of the output growth league table in august .
business activity in ireland rose at the quickest pace since august 2000 , underpinned by a similarly strong increase in new orders .
spain also saw output growth up , driven by the service sector .
in germany , growth slowed at both manufacturers and service firms .
italy dipped back into contraction territory , halting a seven-month expansion , with services particularly weak .
french output shrank for the fourth month running but the pace of decline was mild , '' markit noted , and inflows of new business improved .
manufacturing remains in the doldrums , however .
the decline in july retail sales in the eurozone was mainly caused by a drop in sales of food , drinks and tobacco .

howard archer , economist at ihs global insight , said : july 's 0.4 % drop in eurozone retail sales volumes fuels concern that recently weakening consumer confidence across the eurozone is starting to lead to increased caution in spending , thereby harming growth prospects .
interior view of atrium of galleries lafayette on friedrichstrasse in berlin .

documents.title: eurozone retail sales slow sharply in july
text: more bad news out of the eurozone : retail sales slowed sharply in july , adding to worries about economic growth , which ground to a halt in the second quarter .
eurostat said the volume of retail sales in the 18 countries sharing the euro dropped 0.4 % in july , in line with analysts ' forecasts .
our data team has compiled a couple of charts using ons data .
the ons says the inclusion of paid sex 'n drugs in the gdp data has not really made an impact .

ons ( @ ons ) national accounts changes : updated # gdp growth and balance of payments estimates ons ( @ ons ) effect of including illegal drugs and prostitution in official gdp growth measures is negligible

an hm treasury spokesperson said in response to the ons data : these ons revisions show an economy that has been growing more strongly than previously thought , with almost every quarter under this government being revised upward .
cumulatively , growth since 2010 is now over 1 % stronger .
but the revisions also show that the great recession remains the deepest since records began , and risks to the recovery from europe and elsewhere remain .
that is why we must continue to work through the long term economic plan that is building a resilient economy .
ben chu ( @ benchu ) according to @ twitterid 2007-2009 gdp drop was -4.6 % .
less bad than previous estimate of 5.9 % fall .
ben chu ( @ benchu ) here 's the @ twitterid real gdp level revisions :

documents.title: ons says downturn 'less deep ' than previously thought
text: the office for national statistics has restated the national accounts going back to 1998 to 2012 .
on average , growth has been revised up by 0.1 percentage points per year .
during the recent economic downturn , growth was less weak than previously estimated while , coming out of the downturn , growth has been stronger .
however , the length of the downturn remains unrevised .
the recent downturn has been the deepest since ons records began in 1948 .
the recovery has also been the slowest .
ons chief economist joe grice said : despite the wide ranging improvements underpinning the new estimates , the broad of the economy has not changed much .

although the downturn was less deep than previously estimated and subsequent growth stronger , it remains the case that the uk experienced the deepest recession since ons records began in 1948 and the subsequent recovery has been unusually slow .
over the period 1998-2012 , the overall size of revisions remains small at an average of 0.1 percentage points per year .

documents.title: pmis point to 0.8 % gdp growth in q3 , markit says
text: markit reckons its survey data points to gdp growth of 0.8 % in the third quarter .
it notes , however , that the upturn has become ever more dependent on the domestically-oriented services and construction sectors as growth slowed sharply in manufacturing .
the weakness of the more internationally-focused goods producing sector was linked in part to the escalating crisis in the ukraine .
chris williamson ( @ williamsonchris ) uk recovery maintains strong momentum .
all-sector # pmi rises to 9-month high of 59.8 .

suggests q3 gdp growth of 0.8 % markit 's chief economist chris williamson goes on to say : the data send mixed signals to policy makers , suggesting the debate over whether the economy can withstand higher interest rates will remain intense .

policy makers will certainly be concerned by the extent of the slowdown in manufacturing and will be eager to see whether the global economic uncertainty caused by the ukraine crisis will also filter through to a significant slowdown in services and construction .
some impact is already evident , with growth of new orders moderating in all three sectors in august .
employment growth also slowed further from june 's record high , down to the lowest since march as rates of job creation eased in all three sectors .

the weak manufacturing data plus the slowing of order book and employment growth in services and construction therefore reduce the risk of other members of the bank of england 's monetary policy committee joining ian mcaffferty and martin weale in voting for a hike in interest rates .

dovish policy makers will also be reassured by the pmi surveys showing average prices charged for goods and services barely rising in august , showing the smallest monthly increase since may of last year .
input cost inflation also moderated , helped in part by the falling cost of imports arising from the strong exchange rate .

however , hawkish policy makers will prefer to focus on the overall pmi and especially the strength of the dominant services economy , which shows the economy as a whole gaining further momentum instead of slowing , as the bank 's projections had expected .
the concern is that the growth surge in the domestic economy is eating away spare capacity , which will drive up inflation in the medium term .

documents.title: ftse 100 index rises to 14-year high
text: the ftse 100 index has hit its highest level in more than 14 years after the strong pmi data , climbing nearly 70 points to 6898.62 , a 1 % gain - only 32 points away from its all-time high of 6930 , reached on 31 december 1999 .

documents.title: uk services growth improves to 10-month high but firms worried about ukraine
text: in sharp contrast to the eurozone , the uk services pmi has leapt to a 10-month high of 60.5 from july 's 59.1 , better than expected .
the composite index , which gauges manufacturing , services and construction activity , hit a nine-month high of 59.8 , versus july 's 59.0 .
however , before you reach for the champagne , a word of caution : the ukraine crisis has clouded the outlook .
new business growth at britain 's service sector firms was the weakest in three months , and confidence fell to a 15-month low .

barack obama and estonia 's president toomas hendrik ilves attend a welcome ceremony at the kadriorg palace in tallinn , estonia spooked by russia 's intervention in ukraine , estonia is hoping for a strong signal of support from president obama .
kulbis/ap

chris williamson , chief economist at markit , said : the eurozone economy is defying expectations of gaining momentum , which will no doubt add to calls for the ecb to embark on full-scale quantitative easing .

documents.title: services and manufacturing activity in eurozone weaker , adding pressure on ecb
text: services and manufacturing activity in the eurozone slowed to its weakest pace this year in august as escalating tensions between russia and ukraine took their toll on investment , a closely-watched survey showed .
markit 's composite purchasing managers ' index , which is based on surveys of thousands of companies across the eurozone , fell to an eight-month low of 52.5 , well below july 's 53.8 .
the findings will add to pressure on the european central bank ahead of its meeting tomorrow .
germany , the main engine of growth , saw activity weaken to a 10-month low while france , the eurozone 's second-biggest economy , declined for a fourth month .

documents.title: germany 's services sector growth falls back
text: germany has also seen services sector growth slow : the pmi from markit fell from july 's 37-month high of 56.7 to 54.9 in august .

documents.title: french service sector activity eases
text: italy is stuck in a triple-dip recession , which has wiped out all growth since 2000 .
turning to france , activity in the service sector dipped slightly to 50.3 from 50.4 in july , but stayed in positive territory - while manufacturing output fell sharply last month .

documents.title: italy 's services sector contracts in august
text: in contrast to spain , italy , the eurozone 's third-largest economy , saw a decline in its service industries last month .
the pmi fell to 49.8 , below the key 50 line which signals expansion , from 52.8 in july .
this is the first sub-50 reading since march .

andrew harker , senior economist at markit and author of the report on spain , said : strong growth in activity and new business in august suggest that the economic recovery in spain maintained momentum during the month .
however , other indices from the latest pmi survey highlight the scale of the challenge ahead .
discounting was still required to secure sales in a number of cases , while the latest increase in employment was only marginal despite the fastest rise in activity since late-2006 .
that said , sentiment remained positive as close to half of all respondents forecast activity growth over the coming year .
the spanish stock market has taken heart from the much stronger-than-expected services pmi .
the ibex is trading 62.8 points , or 0.6 % , higher at 10820.6 ,

documents.title: spain posts strongest services growth since 2006
text: spain recorded the fastest rise in services activity since december 2006 , led by the finance industry while hotels and restaurants saw the slowest growth last month .
the headline business activity index surprised economists with a jump to 58.1 in august from 56.2 in july .
european stock markets have opened higher .
the ftse 100 index in london is up 27 points , or 0.4 % , at 6856.7 .
germany 's dax has gained nearly 34 points , or 0.36 % , to 9540.84 while france 's cac has added almost 20 points to 4397.77 , a 0.4 % rise .
returning to the world economic forum 's global competitiveness survey , here 's a list of the top ten .
britain moved up to ninth from tenth place , while finland and germany slipped one place .
switzerland singapore united states finland germany japan hong kong netherlands united kingdom sweden
let 's have a closer look at the chinese services surveys for august .
the china pmi came in at 54.4 , while the hsbc measure came in at 54.2 , a surprise rise from the previous month .
asian shares rose on the news : the shanghai composite index climbed 1.04 % and hong kong 's hang seng gained 2 % .
the irish services pmi is also out , climbing to 62.4 in august from 61.3 in july , well above the 50 expansion line - indicating strong growth .
a reading above 50 signals expansion ; a reading below points to contraction .
markit economics ( @ markiteconomics ) hsbc china services headline # pmi at 54.1 ( 50.0 in july ) .

composite pmi at 52.8 ( july : 51.6 ) michael hewson , chief market analyst at cmc markets uk , says : with all eyes on tomorrows ecb rate meeting and the weak manufacturing numbers earlier this week , markets will be hoping for better numbers from the services sector this morning , with the latest pmi numbers from spain , italy , france and germany due out .

as is the case in china , these numbers have generally performed better than the manufacturing sector in recent months , but they have also started to weaken from their peaks a few months ago , and similar weakness will once again shift the focus back to tomorrow 's rate meeting , especially if any of them slip in contraction .
expectations are for spain to come in at 55.5 , italy at 52 , france at 51.1 and germany at 56.4 , in a further sign of weakening economic activity .
eu retail sales for july are expected to decline 0.3 % , down from the 0.4 % rise seen in june .

in the uk the pound took a bit of a swan dive yesterday despite a much better than expected construction pmi number for august , with some speculating that the pound may be suffering a little bit of a vertigo as a result of the narrowing polls in the scottish referendum .
while that may be partly true the decline can also be put down to a stronger us dollar , and euro short covering ahead of tomorrow 's ecb rate meeting .
today 's services pmi number for august could well give it another nudge lower particularly if it disappoints in the same way as monday 's manufacturing number did .
expectations are for a decline to 58.5 from 59.1 in july .
good morning , and welcome to our rolling coverage of the world economy , the financial markets , the eurozone and business .
we 've woken up to the news that britain has moved up a list of the world 's most competitive economies - to ninth from tenth place .

the world economic forum , a thinktank , praised the government for cutting the public sector deficit and maintaining one of the most flexible labour markets in the developed world , as well as investing in new technologies .
you can read the full story here .
the economic highlight today will be surveys of services sectors across the globe , kicking off with china .
china 's services sector bounced back in august after a drop in july , two surveys showed , offsetting weakness in manufacturing .
the government is determined to achieve its 7.5 % economic growth target this year to keep employment stable , while pushing through long-term reforms .
the latest purchasing managers indices ( pmi ) from european countries for august are due later this morning , with the uk survey to follow at 9.30am bst .

bulletin.text: Eurozone recovery loses steam, dragged down by France and Italy.
UK downturn 'less deep' than previously thought.
but UK workers suffered biggest falls in wages in developed world after crisis.
